00026 class cPar;
00027 
00028 // the most positive int64 value, represented as double
00029 #define INT64_MAX_DBL  9.22337203685e18
00030 
00031 
00048 class SIM_API SimTime
00049 {
00050   private:
00051     int64 t;
00052 
00053     static int scaleexp;     // scale exponent in the range -18..0
00054     static int64 dscale;     // 10^-scaleexp, that is 1 or 1000 or 1000000...
00055     static double fscale;    // 10^-scaleexp, that is 1 or 1000 or 1000000...
00056     static double invfscale; // 1/fscale; we store it because floating-point multiplication is faster than division
00057 
00058   protected:
00059     static void resetScale() {scaleexp = SCALEEXP_UNINITIALIZED;} // for unit tests only
00060 
00061   private:
00062     template<typename T> void check(T d) {if (scaleexp==SCALEEXP_UNINITIALIZED) initError(d);}
00063     void initError(double d);
00064 
00065     bool haveSameSign(int64 a, int64 b) { return (a^b) >= 0; }
00066 
00067     int64 toInt64(double i64) {
00068          if (fabs(i64) > INT64_MAX_DBL)
00069              rangeError(i64);
00070          return (int64)i64;
00071     }
00072 
00073     void checkedAdd(const SimTime& x) {
00074         // if operands are the same sign but result has different sign ==> overflow
00075         bool sameSign = haveSameSign(t, x.t);
00076         t += x.t;
00077         if (sameSign && !haveSameSign(t, x.t))
00078             overflowAdding(x);
00079     }
00080 
00081     void checkedSub(const SimTime& x) {
00082         // if operands are different signs and result has same sign as x ==> overflow
00083         bool differentSign = !haveSameSign(t, x.t);
00084         t -= x.t;
00085         if (differentSign && haveSameSign(t, x.t))
00086             overflowSubstracting(x);
00087     }
00088 
00089     void rangeError(double i64);
00090     void overflowAdding(const SimTime& x);
00091     void overflowSubstracting(const SimTime& x);
00092 
00093   public:
00094     static const int SCALEEXP_S  =  0;
00095     static const int SCALEEXP_MS = -3;
00096     static const int SCALEEXP_US = -6;
00097     static const int SCALEEXP_NS = -9;
00098     static const int SCALEEXP_PS = -12;
00099     static const int SCALEEXP_FS = -15;
00100     static const int SCALEEXP_UNINITIALIZED = 0xffff;
00101 
00105     SimTime() {t=0;}
00106     SimTime(double d) {operator=(d);}
00107     SimTime(cPar& d) {operator=(d);}
00108     SimTime(const SimTime& x) {operator=(x);}
00109     // note: template ctor is not a good idea -- often causes surprises
00110     // template<typename T> SimTime(T d) {operator=(d);}
00111 
00114     const SimTime& operator=(double d) {check(d); t=toInt64(fscale*d); return *this;}
00115     const SimTime& operator=(const cPar& d);
00116     const SimTime& operator=(const SimTime& x) {t=x.t; return *this;}
00117     template<typename T> const SimTime& operator=(T d) {check(d); t=toInt64(dscale*d); return *this;}
00118 
00119     const SimTime& operator+=(const SimTime& x) {checkedAdd(x); return *this;}
00120     const SimTime& operator-=(const SimTime& x) {checkedSub(x); return *this;}
00121 
00122     const SimTime& operator*=(double d) {t=toInt64(t*d); return *this;}
00123     const SimTime& operator/=(double d) {t=toInt64(t/d); return *this;}
00124     const SimTime& operator*=(const cPar& p);
00125     const SimTime& operator/=(const cPar& p);
00126     template<typename T> const SimTime& operator*=(T d) {t*=d; return *this;}
00127     template<typename T> const SimTime& operator/=(T d) {t/=d; return *this;}
00128 
00129     bool operator==(const SimTime& x) const  {return t==x.t;}
00130     bool operator!=(const SimTime& x) const  {return t!=x.t;}
00131     bool operator< (const SimTime& x) const  {return t<x.t;}
00132     bool operator> (const SimTime& x) const  {return t>x.t;}
00133     bool operator<=(const SimTime& x) const  {return t<=x.t;}
00134     bool operator>=(const SimTime& x) const  {return t>=x.t;}
00135 
00136     SimTime operator-() const {SimTime x; x.t = -t; return x;}
00137 
00138     friend const SimTime operator+(const SimTime& x, const SimTime& y);
00139     friend const SimTime operator-(const SimTime& x, const SimTime& y);
00140 
00141     friend const SimTime operator*(const SimTime& x, double d);
00142     friend const SimTime operator*(double d, const SimTime& x);
00143     friend const SimTime operator/(const SimTime& x, double d);
00144     friend double operator/(double d, const SimTime& x);
00145     friend double operator/(const SimTime& x, const SimTime& y);
00146 
00147     friend const SimTime operator*(const SimTime& x, const cPar& p);
00148     friend const SimTime operator*(const cPar& p, const SimTime& x);
00149     friend const SimTime operator/(const SimTime& x, const cPar& p);
00151 
00158     double dbl() const  {return t*invfscale;}
00159 
00163     std::string str() const;
00164 
00172     char *str(char *buf) {char *endp; return SimTime::ttoa(buf, t, getScaleExp(), endp);}
00173 
00177     int64 raw() const  {return t;}
00178 
00182     const SimTime& setRaw(int64 l) {t = l; return *this;}
00183 
00188     static const SimTime getMaxTime() {return SimTime().setRaw(INT64_MAX);}
00189 
00194     static int64 getScale()  {return dscale;}
00195 
00200     static int getScaleExp() {return scaleexp;}
00201 
00214     static void setScaleExp(int e);
00215 
00221     static const SimTime parse(const char *s);
00222 
00232     static const SimTime parse(const char *s, const char *&endp);
00233 
00243     static char *ttoa(char *buf, int64 t, int scaleexp, char *&endp);
00244 };

00248     // linux bug workaround; don't change next two lines

00250     m_value = static_cast<int64>( tmp );
00251     return *this;

00254 inline const SimTime operator+(const SimTime& x, const SimTime& y)
00255 {
00256     return SimTime(x)+=y;
00257 }
00258 
00259 inline const SimTime operator-(const SimTime& x, const SimTime& y)
00260 {
00261     return SimTime(x)-=y;
00262 }
00263 
00264 inline const SimTime operator*(const SimTime& x, double d)
00265 {
00266     return SimTime(x)*=d;
00267 }
00268 
00269 inline const SimTime operator*(double d, const SimTime& x)
00270 {
00271     return SimTime(x)*=d;
00272 }
00273 
00274 inline const SimTime operator/(const SimTime& x, double d)
00275 {
00276     return SimTime(x)/=d;
00277 }
00278 
00279 inline double operator/(double d, const SimTime& x)
00280 {
00281     return d / x.dbl();
00282 }
00283 
00284 inline double operator/(const SimTime& x, const SimTime& y)
00285 {
00286     return (double)x.raw() / (double)y.raw();
00287 }
00288 
00289 inline std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const SimTime& x)
00290 {
00291     char buf[64]; char *endp;
00292     return os << SimTime::ttoa(buf, x.raw(), SimTime::getScaleExp(), endp);
00293 }

00296 
00297 // used locally; needed because sign of a%b is implementation dependent if a<0
00298 inline int64 _i64mod(const int64& any_t, const int64& positive_u)
00299 {
00300     int64 m = any_t % positive_u;
00301     return m>=0 ? m : m+positive_u;
00302 }
00303 
00307 inline const OPP::SimTime floor(const OPP::SimTime& x)
00308 {
00309     int64 u = OPP::SimTime::getScale();
00310     int64 t = x.raw();
00311     return OPP::SimTime().setRaw(t - _i64mod(t,u));
00312 }
00313 
00321 inline const OPP::SimTime floor(const OPP::SimTime& x, const OPP::SimTime& unit, const OPP::SimTime& offset = OPP::SimTime())
00322 {
00323     int64 off = offset.raw();
00324     int64 u = unit.raw();
00325     int64 t = x.raw() - off;
00326     return OPP::SimTime().setRaw(t - _i64mod(t,u) + off);
00327 }
00328 
00332 inline const OPP::SimTime ceil(const OPP::SimTime& x)
00333 {
00334     int64 u = OPP::SimTime::getScale();
00335     int64 t = x.raw() + u-1;
00336     return OPP::SimTime().setRaw(t - _i64mod(t,u));
00337 }
00338 
00343 inline const OPP::SimTime ceil(const OPP::SimTime& x, const OPP::SimTime& unit, const OPP::SimTime& offset = OPP::SimTime())
00344 {
00345     int64 off = offset.raw();
00346     int64 u = unit.raw();
00347     int64 t = x.raw() - off + u-1;
00348     return OPP::SimTime().setRaw(t - _i64mod(t,u) + off);
00349 }
00350 
00354 inline const OPP::SimTime fabs(const OPP::SimTime& x)
00355 {
00356     return x.raw()<0 ? OPP::SimTime().setRaw(-x.raw()) : x;
00357 }
00358 
00362 inline const OPP::SimTime fmod(const OPP::SimTime& x, const OPP::SimTime& y)
00363 {
00364     return OPP::SimTime().setRaw(x.raw() % y.raw());
00365 }
